SENT.plain: OBJECTIVES: Burkitt's lymphoma (BL) occurs mostly in children
Isolated bilateral ovarian involvement presenting with amenorrhea is extremely rare in young adults
CASE: A 24-year-old female presented with secondary amenorrhea
Bilateral adnexal masses were identified on physical examination and abdominal computed tomography (CT)
She underwent total abdominal histerectomy and bilateral salpingoophorectomy
Histopathologic evaluation yielded a diagnosis of BL of ovaries
After complete remission an autologous bone marrow transplantation (ABMT) was performed
CONCLUSIONS: Although rare, BL should be kept in mind when isolated ovarian tumors are detected in young patients
